ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: A group of benevolent people of Ashutosh Colony and Shahidnagar Colony area established SAUJATYA for the people of the locality on the 1st day of April1972. They thought that to work for mankind is more important than any other things. They dreamt of a socialistic pattern of society. Every human being has treamendous potentiality but they are not aware of their own strength. The Managing Committee of Saujatya tried to kindle the light in the lives of poor, uneducated and ignored people of the India. The Managing Committee has started five units the CULTURAL UNIT, DRAMA UNIT, MEDICAL UNIT, RELIEF UNIT AND SPORTS UNITS. After sometime, the organisation has started Social Welfare Unit to improve the Social Economic status of the local people. Hence forth, the organisation has been working in the field of HUMAN RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT by expending programmes day by day. RAJIB GANDHI NATIONAL CRECHE SCHEME, to give shelter, food and medicine to the children of working mothers and illness mothers throughout the year free of cost. SHORT-STAY-HOME is established for the destitute women. They will stay there upto 3 years with their children of below 7 years. They will get shelter, food and clothing. They will stand on their own foot within three years through different types of vocational training. HELP LINE 10923 to rescue and to help the distress women through telecounselling. WOMEN WORKING HOSTEL, the women who are working and receiving maximum of Rs. 300 per month, are may be permission to stay there with minimum cost. FAMILY COUNSELLING CENTRE, it is started to solve the Family problem through counselling and shelter to the destitute women. Above mention programmes are guided and sponsored by the Central Social welfare Board, Govt. of India. BALWADI, to give nutritious food to the malnutritious children are of 3 to 6 years and pregnant mother throughout the yearfree of cost. This programme supported by the West Bengal Social Welfare Advisory Board. SWADHAR SHELTER HOME it is started for mentally ill women and girls. They will stay there free of cost. They will receive food, clothing, medicine, vocational training and rehabilitation etc.This programme sponsored by the Ministry of Women and Children Development, Govt. of India. DESTITUTE HOME, the children from 5 to 18 years are living here free of cost. They are getting food, clothing, medicine and education at free of cost. This programme sponsored by the Ministry of Women and Child Development and Directorate of Social Welfare, Govt. of West of Women. SARBA SIKSHA AVIJAN, this centre is working for disable children in the locality to Sonarpur B.D.O. and Rajpur Sonarpur Municipality at free of cost. This programme is sponsored by Ministry of Education, Govt. of West Bengal. We also convey our gratefulness to all the staff, officers and all concerned of various departments of Govt. of West Bengal, Govt. of India and Local Government authorities and local people.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The TRUST directly or through its two other operating units e.g. VIVEKANANDA NETHRALAYA & AROGYO MULTISPECIALITY HOSPITAL are regularly providing services to the deprived, underpriviledged, poor rural folk belonging to the different backward classes including the categories of Tribal,SC,ST and other minorities apart from those belonging to general categories. Programmes related with Nation Building,Value Education, Development of Social Awareness, Community Health,Water Preservation,Pure Drinking Water, Forestry,Tree Plantation and Environment, Education of Girl Child, Science & computer Education etc., are regularly organised under the banner of the Trust. Out-reach Camps for treatment and screening of various ailments and deseases related with Eye and General Health of the rural people are regularly being conducted by Vivekananda Nethralaya and Arogyo Multispeciality Hospital in different parts of the state of Jharkhand and West Bengal. OPD & IPD facilities for 7 days in a week are provided. 5000 eye surgeries & 300 other surgeries/year, apart from treatment of other physical ailments, are done.School health programmes are organised free of cost.Free Eye surgeries and distribution of spectacles are done regularly.Awareness programmes for Eye & other Organ Donation are organised for villagers and school children through Drama and Baul Song etc.Nearly 2000 school students of 40 primary schools have been examined and treated free of cost.Nearly 200000 rural people have been examined & provided treatment for different ailments, including eye & other surgeries performed on them, free of cost. Screening and awareness development programmes for Diabetes patients are done regularly.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The organisation has been able to intervene 56 child abuse cases, 118 medical cases, 213 missing children cases and 86 shelter cases for the distressed children. A huge and long standing rapport has been developed with the 35 Gram Panchayats and 16 councilor in the entire block of Baduriya, Swarupnagar, Habra-1 , Habra 2 and Deganga. The organisation has provided pre-primary non-formal education to 32,016 boys and 33,862 girls, all in the age-group of 5-14. 4,591 boys and 4,665 girls have already been mainstreamed into various private and government-run formal schools. 25 trafficked victims have been rescued and restored with the families. 18 FIR have been lodged by the organisation in against of the traffickers. 54 child trafficking cases have been documented by the organisation where the where about of the victims are not known. The organisation identified 123 volunteers in the community those who are actively supporting the organisation for spreading awareness and case referral. The organisation has been actively working on promotion and activation of JJ systems and promotion of RTE act in the various block level of North 24 Pgs, West Bengal. It is also working for linking children and their families with the different welfare schemes of the government and the non-govt organisation. The organisation has set up of a child friendly corner at Habra police stations with the involvement of MP, MLA and local councillors. It also achieve to promote awareness of child rights with the help of the station master of Machlandapur and Habra railway station where all police personnel proactively supported the organisation. The Organisation has set up 87 SHGs in 36 villages of various blocks of North 24 Pgs. Women involved in this group have been linked with the entrepreneurship development programme and earning their livelihood.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: For holding activity based Science Camp for SC/ST/OBC students of Nayagram Block for understanding concepts in Scientific theories based to their syllaus through hands on experiments with the help of low cost inovative experiments designed by the Centre

State level workshop where teachers and science communicators from all over West Bengal participated and learn basic experiments on so called miracles and practiced under the guidance of expert Dr. Narendra Nayak ,a listed resource person . He becomes local level resource persons to stage show and perform tricks against superstitions.

In connection with the Celebration of International Year of light and Light based Technology 2015 four hands-on activities for students of age group 15-17years in four district, one state level workshop on the preparation and application of experiments on optics for Physics teachers and a seminar on Laser Technology for undergraduate and PG Physics students were successfully implemented to focus the importance of light .. Also discussion on contribution of Al-hazen a Physicist was organized.

More than hundred students from 12-school of age group 13-15 years and teachers participated in a two day science camp and performed experiments on basics of science under the guidance of experts. The camp was inaugurated by Mr. A.K Kalidaha, Senior Scientific Officer, Department of Science and Technology, Biotechnology, Government of West Bengal. The children were very satisfied and expressed their views in the feedback that more such activities would be organized for conceptual development .
no grants received either from State / Central Government. Activities carried out with local support.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Himalayan Nature & Adventure Foundation(HNAF) is a leading non profit voluntary organization based in Siliguri,West Bengal Estd. in 1990 and registered under West Bengal Society Registration Act in 1996 and affiliated to Indian Mountaineering Foundation , New Delhi. Long term support and involvement in the man animal conflict management of the region having actively participated in the awareness programs, capacity building of the staff and villagers and Tea Garden workers and forest fringed villages. Organizing Nature Study Camps over a period of more than 25 years, for all categories of Differently Abled boys and girls from all over the country(probably HNAF is the only organization in India to organize such camp regularly),as well as for the children in distress and general boys & girls. Survey and bird census and annual water fowl counts in various PAs and different wetlands, and Reserve Forests of North Bengal Completed Survey on Fishes of North Bengal in 3 major National Park/Santuaries Conducted and participated in collaboration with State Forest Dept.various censes of Rhino, Elephant, Tiger and Red Panda A three year Glacial study & exploration in the Onglathang & Rathong Glacier in west Sikkim Himalaya a project of Viswavarathi University, Santiniketan in collaboration with HNAF in which HNAF supported with strong technical & human resource Regular Cleaning and awareness campaigning in Siliguri city and different Himalayan trek routes Mountaineering Expeditions : Already organized Eight climbing expedition including 2 unclimbed peaks of Indian Himalaya.Organized regular Trekking, Rock climbing Courses, Annual Adventure Trekking & Camping Courses for youths of the state Etc. Pant National Institute of Himalayan Environment & Sustainable Development, Gantok, Sikkim. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Since the inception in the year 1952 SILPIMON as a theatre Group has been playing a pioneering role in the field of theatre movement .We have been consistantly holding Drama Festivals and theatreworkshops, promoting cultural activities among the rural youths and producing dramas in our stage and hired stages at kolkata and also at other stages at rural areas .We publishe theatre Journal PROSCENIUM where stalwarts like Utpal Dutta. Tapas Sen , Jochan Dastidar and many contemporary theatre personalities subscribed . In 1972 we established a open air theater Stage BINODINI NATYA MANDIR and dedicated to the memory of Binodini, the legendary actress of renaissance Bengal . In 2013 on the occassion of 150th birth aniversary of Binodini we took up a yearlong program and introduced Binodini memorial speech and Binodino memorial Award worg Rs. 5000/- to a veteran theater personality . many of our theater productiond in the rcent years three out standing productions are Darpan , Binod Katah and Musalparba . At present we are organizing week end theater performances in colaboration with threee other theater groups and we are getting a massive response.

ngoList.ngoName: SITARAM BHARTIA INSTITUTE OF SCIENCE AND RESEARCH
ngoList.address: Regd OfficeBlock 1 E, 216 AJC Bose Road, Kolkata700017Office B16, Qutab Institutional Area, New Delhi - 110016
ngoList.title: SITARAM BHARTIA INSTITUTE OF SCIENCE AND RESEARCH
ngoList.actName: THE WEST BENGAL SOCIETIES REGISTRATION ACT 1961
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The institution was founded in 1979 with a spirit of serving society through research. With our focus on health we have evolved into an organization that combines medical research with excellence in patient care. All research on human subjects is conducted only after requisite clearance from regulatory authorities, an independent ethical committee and informed written consent by the participants. The institution through intramural funding and extramural grants, conceived and conducted projects directly relevant to policy, public health and clinical practice needs of the nation. We focused on translational research in clinical epidemiology, nutrition, maternal and child health, systematic reviews, quality of care and non-communicable diseases. Extramural grants have been received from both national and international sources including the Indian Council of Medical Research, Department of Biotechnology and World Health Organization. Prestigious international and national collaborations were also forged to achieve these objectives. The quantum and quality of recent research output (since 2006) is evident from 214 publications. Of these 113 are in internationally indexed journals (66 with High and 41 with Moderate Impact Factor), 44 in nationally indexed journals and 38 in non-indexed journals. The very high impact journals include the Lancet, BMJ, Cardiology, JAMA, Diabetes Care, and Nature Reviews. Seventeen Reports have been submitted to the funding agencies including the World Health Organization, Geneva and Indian Council of Medical Research, and two books have been published. The research output has been utilized for formulating national and global policy. Notable examples include the global decision of World Health Organization, Geneva in relation to neonatal Vitamin A supplementation, home based care to prevent neonatal mortality and short course antibiotic therapy for otitis media on the basis of systematic reviews conducted by the institution. The research efforts have also received recognition in the form of national awards and orations. Research findings have been disseminated by organization of workshops, conferences and Continuing Medical Education series. The institution has also co-hosted evidence based meetings to formulate Indian Academy of Pediatrics guidelines for diarrhoea and severe malnutrition. Further, lectures have been delivered at various national and international events. Contributions have been made at international and national meetings, workshops, task forces, expert groups and research advisory committees to formulate policy and deliberate upon various topical policy issues. These include World Health Organization, Geneva; International Atomic Energy Association, Vienna; Health Effects Institute, USA; Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India; Ministry of Women and Child Development, Government of India; Department of Biotechnology, Government of India; National Advisory Council on Nutrition; and Indian Council of Medical Research. The institution has also provided editorial services for respected international and national journals. International and national research trials have been supported through chairing or membership of Data Safety Monitoring Boards. Evidence based and ethical information has been imparted to the consumers in the form of lectures and distribution of printed information. Specifically, an evidence based booklet has been produced to educate the parents of newborns about giving a healthy start to life.
